He performs his work with passion, which enables him to meet his needs and those of his children. Bodjrènou Bertin gets his agricultural inputs in an area of Benin.

In the pursuit of his customers' satisfaction and in order to increase his working capital, Bodjrènou Bertin is requesting a 3rd loan from ALIDé so that he can grow corn, okra and peppers. This loan will enable him to better respond to the demands of his clientèle and to make more profits. The previous loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: to cultivate corn, okra and peppers.

loans.name: Justin Godonou

texts.fr: Justin Godonou est âgé de 46 ans et est marié une marchande du nom de Philomène. Le couple a huit enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. En dehors de leurs enfants, le couple a deux autres enfants à leur charge. Justin Godonou n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Justin Godonou vit ensemble avec ses enfants et sa femme. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Il y a longtemps que Justin Godonou exerce comme activité, la production agricole. Justin Godonou exerce passionnément cette activité, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Justin Godonou s’approvisionne en intrants dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement, Justin Godonou sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé, pour cultiver du niébé, du maïs et du piment. Ce crédit lui servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de sa clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Justin Godonou is 46 years old and is married to a merchant called Philomène. The couple have 8 dependent children, some of whom attend school. As well as their own children, the couple are responsible two other children. Justin Godonou did not go to school. He lives together with his children and his wife. The couple both take care of the different household expenses. Justin Godonou has been a farmer for a long time. He performs his work with passion, which allows him to meet his needs and those of his children. Justin Godonou gets his agricultural inputs in a region of Benin.

In the pursuit of customer satisfaction and in order to increase his working capital, Justin Godonou is requesting a 5th loan from ALIDé so that he can grow black-eyed peas, corn and peppers. This loan will enable him to better respond to the demands of his clientèle and to make more profits. The previous loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: to grow black-eyed peas, corn and peppers.

loans.name: Macrina

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Macrina works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Macrina is borrowing 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store like canned goods, sugar, milk, noodles, etc.

Macrina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store like canned goods, sugar, milk, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy paper, gum, and glue for a paper envelope manufacturing business

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic works hard to support her family. Marivic is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Marivic requested a 15,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Marivic has been in this business for 3 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Flordelyn

texts.en:
Flordelyn is married and has 2 children. Flordelyn is 34 years old and lives in Pta. Sulong, Baliangao.

Flordelyn sells grocery items to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns 3600 Philippine Pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 7000 PHP to purchase fishing net.

Flordelyn has been a member of PMPC for 8 years.

loans.use: To purchase fishing net

loans.name: Komil

texts.ru: Комилу 44 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами несколько лет назад он начал свой бизнес услугами таксиста. Комил единственный кормилец в семье и старается обеспечить детей и жену со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Его доход не позволяет ему отремонтировать его дом, а он должен срочно отремонтировать свой дом, так как его дом имеет плохое состояние. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Komil is 44 years old. He is married with two children. With the goal of providing his family with all the needed resources, several years ago he started his own business providing taxi services. Komil is the sole breadwinner for the family and is trying to provide his children and wife with all their needs. 

His salary does not allow him to repair his home, and he should immediately repair it as it is poorly constructed. 

He is requesting a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy construction materials. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing his house

loans.name: Amretdin

texts.ru: Амретдину 54 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Он очень трудолюбивый и честный человек. Более 30 лет он работает в организации сварщиком. Его коллеги очень уважают и дорожат его дружбой, так как он очень верный друг. Его жена домохозяйка и поэтому он единственный кормилец в семье. Его зарплата не хватает обеспечить семью со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Его дети год за годом требуют больше благ. Он должен купить мебель для дома, то есть диван и кресло, так как скоро у него будут гости. Данное время у него нет возможности принимать гостей. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки мебели. Он обещает погасить займ во время. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Amretdin is 54 years old. He is married and is raising three children. He is a very hardworking and honest person. For more than 30 years, he has been working as a welder at a company. His colleagues very much respect and cherish his friendship, because he is a very loyal friend. 

His wife is a homemaker and therefore he is the sole breadwinner for the family. His salary is not sufficient to provide the family with all the needed resources. Year after year, his children require more support. He must buy furniture for his home--to have a sofa and chair--as he will soon have guests. At this time he cannot receive visitors. He is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy furniture. He promises to repay the loan on time. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: To buy furniture for his house

loans.name: Gf Wangnime Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "GF WANGNIME" est composé de huit personnes qui sont des amis et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Bode Jeanne est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Bode Jeanne est âgée de 34 ans et vit au Bénin. Bode Jeanne est mariée à Grégoire, un cultivateur. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés, et tous à leur charge. Le couple assure ensemble avec leurs enfants les diverses charges familiales. Bode Jeanne n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Bode Jeanne fait de l’agriculture depuis dix sept ans. Bode Jeanne s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Bode Jeanne désire augmenter la culture du piment, du maïs et des légumes. Pour ce faire, Bode Jeanne sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe "GF WANGNIME", l’appui de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The "Gf Wangnime" group is made up of 8 people who are friends and belong to the same mutual funds group. This is the fifth time that this group requests financial support from ALIDé, in order to increase their level of business.

The group's representative, Bode Jeanne, is the woman with her hand raised in the picture. She is 34 years old and lives in Benin. Bode Jeanne is married to Grégoire, a farmer. The couple have 3 dependent children, some of whom attend school. The couple and their children share the different family responsibilities. Bode Jeanne did not go to school. She has been farming for 17 years. She gets her supplies in an area of Benin.

In the pursuit of customer satisfaction, Bode Jeanne would like to increase her production of peppers, corn and vegetables. In order to do this, Bode Jeanne is requesting support from ALIDé, together with the other members of the "Gf Wangnime" group.

loans.use: to grow peppers, corn and vegetables.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 5 filhos dos quais 2 vão a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É operária a agrícola numa empresa de produção de bananas. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, barrotes, chapas, e outros), para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja terminar a sua casa e mobilar, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é economizar mais fundos e poder adquirir mais empréstimos
texts.en:
Carolina is single and has five children, two of whom attend school. She lives with her family in a house she owns and doesn't support anyone else.
She's an agricultural worker for a company that produces bananas. With the current loan she intends to purchase construction supplies (cement, iron, beams, metal sheets, etc.) in order to continue building her house.
In the future she wishes to finish building and furnishing her house. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge she faces is saving more funds and being able to apply for more loans.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, iron, beams, metal sheets, etc.) in order to continue building her house.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 59 years old, married to Pedro, and together they are raising nine children. Her family lives a less fortunate lifestyle. To make a living, Tita cultivates rice as the source of her income. She plants and harvests rice. Sometimes, her spouse helps her transplant rice seedlings to the farm. According to Tita, rice farming requires patience and determination. 

Tita wants to achieve more crop production, so she is asking for a loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy pesticides and fertilizer to ensure a good crop in her rice field. In the future, she would like to continue generating a good income from her farming business. Tita also promises to pay the said loan amount on time.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizer to ensure a good crop in her rice field.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 58 years old, a mixed crop farmer, and he is married to Grace who is also a farmer. They are blessed with six children. He has been in the farming business for the past eighteen years with the monthly income of KES 19,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a credit officer. Peter will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. 


With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hope is to export his farm produce.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for use on his farm.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 54 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Nilda has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Nilda has been in this business for 20 years.  In the future, Nilda would like to save enough to achieve financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 42 years old, married, and has two children. Narcisa is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs.

Narcisa has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain this business.

In the future, Narcisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana tiene 24 años y nació en Barranquilla, Colombia. Estudió Economía en el Instituto de Estudios Económicos del Caribe de la Universidad del Norte, gracias al apoyo económico de sus padres soportados por préstamos realizados en cada una de las empresas que laboran.

Diana tiene el sueño de realizar una maestría en el Reino Unido y el apoyo de Kiva ayudaría a que pueda pagar la inscripción al examen de TOEFL, la traducción de la documentación académica al inglés, la aplicación a las universidades en el Reino Unido y la visa.

Una vez realice su maestría y regrese a Colombia, Diana tiene el sueño de trabajar desde los sectores público, privado y la academia, como una líder de ciudad y de opinión, que fomente el desarrollo de políticas públicas y estrategias para promover la educación del recurso humano de la ciudad y cree estrategias para la generación de empleo efectivo que impulse el desarrollo y mejore los niveles de calidad de vida de su ciudad y el país. 

Aquí está su historia:
A pesar de que cuento con el apoyo de mi familia para cumplir este sueño, mis padres no pueden llegar a cubrir gastos tan elevados como estos debido a su limitada situación económica. Y aunque cuento con mi trabajo como profesora, los recursos que genero en la actualidad son para apoyar a mi familia y los estudios de mi hermano.

Kiva sería un gran apoyo e impulso para poder lograr mi sueño de estudiar mi maestría en el Reino Unido. Me encuentro convencida de que las personas para poder desarrollar nuevas ideas y aprender buenas prácticas de desarrollo, deben conocer en vivencia propia lo realizado por esos países para alcanzar el desarrollo, nuevas oportunidades y nuevos métodos de “como hacerlo mejor”; y sé que gracias a mi excelencia académica, mi proactividad por aprender y un gran esfuerzo puedo alcanzar este sueño.

Para mí sería un motivo de orgullo y satisfacción poder contribuir al desarrollo de mi ciudad y de mi país, de poder por medio de estrategias y/o programas bajo alianzas público-privadas, impactar positivamente en la mejora de la calidad de vida de las personas más vulnerables y del desarrollo económico de mi ciudad. Soy consciente que una maestría en las mejores Universidades del Reino Unido en materia de desarrollo, me dará las herramientas necesarias y el conocimiento para lograr alcanzar esta meta propuesta, la única garantía que tengo es poner todo mi empeño y dar lo mejor de mí.
texts.en:
Diana, 24, was born in Barranquilla, Colombia.  She studied Economics at the Universidad Del Norte’s Institute for Caribbean Economic Studies thanks to her parents’ support who got loans from each of the firms they work for.  Diana’s dream is to study for a Master’s degree in the United Kingdom and Kiva’s support will help her be able to pay the application fee for the TOEFL exam, for the translation of her transcripts into English, for her application fees to universities in the United Kingdom and for her visa.

Once she gets her Master’s and returns to Colombia, Diana dreams with working in the public, private or academic sector as a city and opinion leader who will foster the development of public policy and strategy to promote education of the city’s human resources and create strategies for effective jobs creation that will push development and improve the levels of quality of living in her city and in the country.

This is her story:

Notwithstanding my family’s support to reach this dream, my parents are unable to cover such high costs as these because of their limited economic situation.  Even though I have my job as a teacher, the resources I generate at present are to support my family and help pay for my brother’s education.

Kiva would be of great help and encouragement for me to reach my dream of studying for a Master’s in the United Kingdom.  I’m convinced that in order for people to be able to develop new ideas and learn good development practices they must learn through their own experience what other countries have done in order to develop: new opportunities and new methodologies for “doing it better;” and I know that thanks to my academic excellence and my proactivity to learn and with a great amount of effort, I can reach this dream.

For me, it would be a source of pride and satisfaction to contribute to my city’s and my country’s development and to be able through strategies and/or programs in public-private alliances to impact positively in improving the quality of life of those most vulnerable and in my city’s economic development.  I’m aware that a Master’s in Development from one of the best universities in the United Kingdom would give me the necessary tools and knowledge to reach this set goal.  The only guarantee I have is putting all my effort into it and giving the best I have of myself.

loans.use: to pay application fees for a Master's in Economic Development.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 69 years old, a mixed crop farmer, married to Mary, a farmer. They are blessed with seven children. He has been in the farming business for the past thirty-two years with the monthly income of KES 20,000 which he uses to support his family. 


He is applying for his fourth loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. David will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. 


With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hope is to export his agricultural produce.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilize for his farm.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a 45-year-old married woman and mother of six children from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in the fishing business together with her husband for more than 20 years now. This the source of their income.

Zenaida is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, fish hooks and other items. With this, her husband will be able to improve his daily catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, fish hooks and others

loans.name: Fernando

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 3 filhos dos quais 2 vão a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta a sua mãe e 1 sobrinho enviando dinheiro para auxiliar nas despesas alimentares.
É operário de vendas na empresa Darling e tem um negócio próprio de criação e venda de frangos. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (pintos, ração, vitaminas, e outros), para aumentar a sua produção. 
No futuro deseja fazer crescer o negócio e remodelar a sua casa, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a insuficiência de fundos e o pagamento devido do empréstimo
texts.en:
Fernando is married and has three children, two of whom attend school. He lives with his family in a house he owns and also supports his mother and a nephew by sending money to help with their food expenses.
He works in sales for a company named Darling, and he owns his own business raising and selling broiler chickens. With the current loan he intends to purchase supplies (chicks, feed, vitamins, etc.) in order to increase production.
In the future he wishes to expand his business and remodel his house. For that reason he pledges to repay the loan as scheduled so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge he faces is not having enough funds and repaying the loan within schedule.

loans.use: to purchase supplies (chicks, feed, vitamins, etc.) for raising broiler chickens.

loans.name: Pampila

texts.en:
Pampila is 55 years old, married, and has two children.  She is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years. 

Pampila is requesting her tenth loan from NWFT for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional livestock to sell.  In the future, Pampila would like to expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Deylin

texts.es: Deylin, tiene la edad  de 41 años, está casada,  vive con sus hijos y esposo. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de gallinas ponedoras y de alimento para el desarrollo de las mismas y de esta manera tengan una buena fortaleza y puedan producir huevos de buena calidad. Con este dinero espera invertir más en el proyecto. Con los posibles ingresos que pueda obtener los invertirá en mejoras en el local de las gallinas y cumplir algunas metas personales como mejoramiento de la educación y una mejor calidad de vida. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Deylin, 41, is married and lives together with her husband and children. With this loan, she wants to buy laying hens and feed for their maintenance, so that they grow strong and can lay good quality eggs. With this money, she expects to invest even more in the project. With the eventual income she makes, she will invest in improvements for the pen where she keeps her hens and in some personal projects; she wants to study and improve her quality of life.

This is the first loan she receives from FUDECOSUR. She had not had previous loans with governmental banks, but FUDECOSUR provided a loan with better terms and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy laying hens.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her fishing business.

Aida has been in this business for three years. Aida earns additional income from a general store.

Aida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, tiene la edad  de 47 años, está casada,  vive con sus hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de madera y pagar mano de obra para la reparación de su casa, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que quiere es poder comprar los mejores materiales y de buena calidad para que su casa quede en buen estado y así mejorar su calidad de vida.  Con las mejoras a su vivienda espera tener un lugar más adecuado donde vivir y tener más liquidez para estudiar y en un futuro poder tener un ingreso mejor y ayudar más su familia. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Carmen is 47 years old, married, and lives with her children who are her top priority.  She will use the money from this loan to buy lumber and pay for labor to make repairs to her house.  In this way she can be certain that the work is done well.  She wants to buy the best quality materials so that her home ends up in a good state.  After the repairs she expects to have a better place to live and have more ability to study and have a better income to be able to help her family in the future.  This will be her first loan through FUDECOSUR.  She has not had prior loans with established banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided her a loan with ease and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to repair her home.

loans.name: Domecita

texts.en:
Domecita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing and fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net for her fishing/fish-vending business.

Domecita has been in this business for one year. Domecita earns additional income from raising pigs.

Domecita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net for her fishing business.

loans.name: Jordy Emanuel

texts.es: Jordy, tiene la edad  de 18 años, está soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer  la eliminación de maleza y algunas labores culturales como curvas a nivel para evitar la erosión por el agua principalmente, además la compra de fertilizante para que la plantación llegue a la próxima cosecha en buenas condiciones y en forma manual para no utilizar químicos y así conservar mejor las propiedades del suelo y para realizar una resiembra de café de la variedad Catuahí rojo,  de esta manera espera sembrar un cultivo de buena calidad y que a mediano plazo tener una plantación adecuada. Además de poder comprar unas plantas de almácigo para realizar siembra, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Jordy is 18 years old, single, and lives with his parents and brothers who are his number one priority. With his loan he will try to get rid of the weeds and do some labor like making contour lines to prevent erosion. He is also going to buy fertilizer so that his lands make it to the next harvest in good condition and without the use of chemicals so that he can conserve the better properties of the soil and be able to replant coffee of the red Catuahí variety. In this way, he will plant a harvest of the highest quality and in the shorter term have a big enough field. Other than purchasing some seedbeds to plant  he will also take advantage of the fertile soil and climate conditions and other factors that favor the cultivation of coffee. With improved harvests, he hopes to earn more and be able to improve his family's living conditions and also invest a little in his harvest and achieve some other goals. This is the first loan he is applying for with FUDECOSUR. He has not had any other loans from national banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with better terms and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: harvest coffee beans.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 34 years old. A businessman, he is married to Jacinta, a business lady. They are blessed with two children. He has been running a general shop for the past ten years with the monthly income of KES 20,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a credit officer. Michael will use the loan to purchase more of sacks of sugar, rice, and cartons of cooking fat for sale. 


With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop and improve the family living standard.

loans.use: to purchase more of sacks of sugar, rice, and cartons of cooking fat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 53 years old and married with eight children.

Vicenta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store like sugar, milk, soap, coffee, etc.

Vicenta has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from raising livestock and selling coconut wine.

Vicenta aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store like sugar, milk, soap, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina is a mother who is aiming for a happy and successful life. She is 39 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are currently residing in a rural community and they make a living through farming. Due to the high cost of communities and school fees, Marcelina engages in raising pigs to supplement her husband's income. She plans to improve the business to increase her profits. Since she has insufficient capital, she is requesting an additional 17,000 PHP to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines needed in hog-raising. She believes that the loan will enable her to improve the business and continue to work hard and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines needed in hog-raising

loans.name: Clarissa

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Clarissa works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and e-loading businesses. Clarissa is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

Clarissa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, soap, sugar, coffee, etc. to sell in her general store.

Flora has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from raising pigs.

Flora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, soap, sugar, coffee, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ma. Merlin

texts.en:
Merlin is 39 years old, married, and three young children. Her husband is a fisherman. 

Merlin is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items. With the loan, her husband will be able to enhance his daily catch and provide more fish to sell in the market.  In the future, Merlin dreams of making their business a success. She also wants to save money for the education of their children.

loans.use: to purchase new fishing nets, lead weights, and hooks.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 62 years old and married with seven children. Gloria works very hard to provide for her family.

Gloria runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

Gloria has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, rice, snack foods and other groceries. 

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money to provide financial security for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Ramazon

texts.en:
Ramazon is a hardworking and industrious man. He is married and has five children for whom he has always wanted to provide a good quality of life. 

Ramazon began his own taxi business two years ago. In this way, he is able to provide his children with a good education and solve his financial challenges little by little. 

He is asking for a loan to repair his car so he will have the opportunity to provide better service and increase his income. This will allow him to offer his children and wife a better quality of life and enjoy better financial opportunities for getting ahead.

loans.use: To repair his car for his taxi business.

loans.name: Jefferson

texts.en:
Jefferson's goal in life is to provide a progressive living for his family. He is 34 years old and has been cultivating rice as a source of his income for nearly 15 years. He goes to the field every day to ensure he cultivates good crops. Farming is quite difficult as a source of income, but Jefferson is a patient man who sacrifices a lot for his family. 

Jefferson wants to improve his income so he can pay for the tuition fees and allowances for his two children. Jefferson aims to strengthen his business so he is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. 

In the future, Jefferson would like to keep generating abundant harvests in his rice field and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides needed for his farming business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 42 years old, married and has only one child. They live happily in a rural community where they are able to plant and raise livestock for sale. Due to hardships of living, Evelyn is involved in raising hogs to supplement her husband's income. She has been in the business for almost four years and usually earns a profit of 7,000 PHP a month. She planned to raise more pigs to sell in the local community, but she has inadequate capital. Therefore, she is requesting for an additional 20,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. Through patience and sacrifices, Evelyn believes that the business will grow and become a viable and profitable source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.en:
Prudencia is a 50-year-old fish vendor from Talibon, Bohol. She has been in the fish-vending business for several years now. This is the source of her income. Prudencia is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell to the people in her place.

In the future, Prudencia dreams of expanding her business so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 42 years old and married with 2 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Melinda has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. She requested a 17,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional items like rice, snack foods, canned goods and other miscellaneous items.

 In the future, Melinda would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional items like rice, snack foods, canned goods and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Gloryvic

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Gloryvic works hard to support her family. She has a farming business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Gloryvic is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers for her farm.

Gloryvic has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Rosemlin

texts.en:
Rosemlin is 35 years old, married and has three children. Rosemlin is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Rosemlin requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase livestock to raise.

Rosemlin has been raising livestock for six years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain this business.

In the future, Rosemlin would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to raise

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en: Reynaldo is a humble farmer from San Pedro, Alicia in the province of Isabela. He is married to a housewife, and he is now 42 years of age. They were blessed with four children, whom he sends to school. Reynaldo owns a hectare plot of land which he plants and cultivates with rice to merchandise. This is Reynaldo's primary source of income. He usually acquires a net income of 20,000 PHP each harvest season, during the months of April and November. Now, Reynaldo is borrowing a loan amount of 25,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and insecticides in order to maintain good crops from his farm. In the future, he aims to alleviate his family from poverty.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides in order to maintain good crops from his farm

loans.name: Victoria

texts.ru: Виктория торгует в местном торговом центре, реализует женскую одежду, а именно нарядные платья на выход. Кредит понадобился для закупки зимних туник, и теплых платьев, которые хорошо расходятся в преддверии праздничных корпоративов и торжеств.
texts.en: Victoria works as a retailer at a local shopping centre, where she sells women's clothing, particularly elegant dresses for formal occasions. She needs this loan to stock up on winter tunics and warm dresses, which sell well in advance of the holiday office parties and other gatherings.

loans.use: to buy winter tunics and warm dresses

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna is 46 years old. She lives in Bagaran village of Armavir region with her husband and two children. The family is involved in agriculture. They keep 65 sheep and own a plot of land where different kinds of vegetables and fruits are grown. Ruzanna and her family do all of the relevant agricultural work to ensure a good harvest. The harvested products are then sold at the local open market.

Ruzanna requested this loan to purchase forage for feeding the livestock. This will increase the income for the family and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Francia

texts.en:
Francia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like noodles, canned goods, sugar, spices, etc. for her general store business.

Francia has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from fishing.

Francia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like noodles, canned goods, sugar, spices, etc.

loans.name: Ethrance

texts.en:
Ethrance  is 20 years old and lives in the town of Zirobwe in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, with two of them currently in school. For the past three years, Ethrance  has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which trades in cooking oil and other retail products . 

To help expand her business, Ethrance  has requested a loan of 550,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add more essential commodities such as cooking oil, milk, sugar and salt to be sold, and will help Ethrance  to generate greater profits and grow her business. Ethrance  hopes that in the future she will be able to build houses to rent out. 

Ethrance  is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to add more essential commodities such as cooking oil, milk, sugar and salt to be sold

loans.name: Emilce

texts.es: Emilce, tiene la edad  de 57 años, está casada, vive con su hijo y esposo que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la preparación del terreno como eliminación de maleza y algunas labores culturales como curvas a nivel para evitar la erosión por el agua principalmente ya que el suelo tiene una topografía quebrada y en forma manual para no utilizar químicos y así conservar mejor las propiedades del suelo y para realizar la siembra de café de la variedad Catuahí rojo, de esta manera espera sembrar un cultivo de buena calidad y que a mediano plazo tener una plantación adecuada. También la compra de fertilizantes y pagar mano de otra en trabajos. Además de poder comprar unas plantas de almácigo para realizar siembra, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Emilce is 57 years old, married, and lives with her husband and adult son.  She plans to use the money from this loan to prepare her land by clearing the weeds and do some other work to prevent erosion.  The ground has a broken topography and she does not want to use chemicals in order to better preserve the land so that she can grow a Red Catuahí variety of coffee on it.  In this way she can have a good quality crop and have a good plantation.  She will also buy fertilizer and pay for labor.

Aside from being able to buy some plants, and fertilize the soil, the climate and other things will help produce a good crop.  She hopes to obtain some gains and improve her family’s living conditions and invest a little more in the crop and meet some goals.

This will be her first loan through FUDECOSUR.  She has not had any previous loans from other banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided a loan with great ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant coffee.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is 33 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Glenda has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, canned goods, sugar, etc.

Glenda has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, canned goods, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Glenda works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Glenda is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Glenda has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ceramic material, cement, ceramic tile flooring, dividers, and to pay the laborers.

loans.name: Chynara

texts.ru: Чынара 51 год, замужем, мать 2 детей.Чынара   имеет среднее образование, с самого детства она занималась сельским хозяйством по характеру очень спокойная и старательная женщина. Чынара в качестве источника дохода для своей семьи, еще с советских времен Чынара начала заниматься полеводством и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 5,000 KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Чынара в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 дойные коровы и 10 баранов ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 7,000 сом (KGS) от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чынара обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров. Доходы от кредита Чынара планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса посредством покупки дополнительных голов скота, в будущем планирует сделать ремонт дома.
texts.en: Chynara is 51 years old and is the mother of 2 children. She is a calm and industrious woman by nature. She has a high school education, and has been involved in farming from childhood. From back in Soviet times, Chynara has been working in animal husbandry and growing crops, which is the main source of income for the family. She started this business with a sum of only 5,000 Kyrgyzstan Som (KGS.) Thanks to her persistent hard work, her farm now includes 2 dairy cows and 10 sheep, and brings in monthly earning of around 7,000 Som from the sale of milk and dairy products. For the purpose of further developing her business, Chynara has approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 40,000 Som to buy 2 cows. She plans to re-invest the income generated by this loan into her business by purchasing more head of cattle, and in the future she also plans to repair her house.

loans.use: To purchase 2 cows

loans.name: Mastula's Group

texts.en:
Mastula’s group is composed of two hardworking women. Mastula is 18 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past five years, Mastula has been working hard to manage her small hotel, where she cooks food. 

To help expand her business, Mastula has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy kitchen utensils that will be used in her small hotel, and will help Mastula to generate greater profits and improve on the business. Mastula hopes that in the future she will be able to buy chairs and tables. 

Mastula is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils that will be used in her small hotel.

loans.name: Jenave

texts.en: Jenave works hard to support her family. She is married and works at a basket-making business in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy the materials she needs to make more baskets. Jenave has been in this business for ten years, and her goal for the future is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her basket-making business.

loans.name: Rehemah

texts.en:
Rehemah is 21 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi  in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past three years, Rehemah has been working hard to manage her farming; she grows and sells maize and beans. 

To help expand her business, Rehemah has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase watering cans for the farming business, and will help Rehemah to generate greater profits and live a better life. Rehemah hopes that in the future she will be able to grow more crops. 

Rehemah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase watering cans for the farming business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance

loans.name: Argam

texts.en:
Argam is 31 years old. He lives in Shenik village of Armavir region with his parents, wife and three children. Argam's parents are provided with retirement pensions. 

Argam is involved in livestock breeding. He keeps 15 lambs, two pigs and five cows. Additionally he owns a hectare of agricultural land which needs cultivation. Agriculture is only income in this family, and it is not enough to cover the basic needs of his family. 

Argam has applied for this loan to expand his livestock with 25 lambs and purchase forage for feeding them. Another part of the loan will be used for covering plowing costs, etc., which will improve the quality of the land.

The loan will help to increase their income and Argam will be able to improve living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay for 25 lambs, forage for feeding the livestock, and cover cultivation costs

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel's main source of income comes from planting corn. Due to improvement in his business, he has been able to buy hogs to raise. He currently has four hogs that he is fattening. 

Manuel has raised hogs for one year. His wife is engaged in a direct sales business. He and his wife both work hard to earn a living. The couple has been blessed with three children. Two of his children go to school, while his youngest child is still an infant. He aims to improve his financial stability so he can provide his children a quality education and sustain their daily needs. To make this dream come true, he is asking for additional working capital in the amount of 30,000 PHP, which he will use to buy feed and vitamins. Manuel believes that his hog raising and farming business will continue to improve so he can attain his goals in life and in business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 64-year-old mixed crop farmer. She is married to Kabeu, also a farmer. They are blessed with three school-aged children. She has been in the farming business for the past ten years and earns a monthly income of 9,000 KES, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET LTD customer. Esther will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hope is to export her farm produce.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros is 42 years old, married, and has three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Milagros has a food production business in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Milagros has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Milagros would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Dilshoda

texts.ru: Дилшоде 26 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее муж предприниматель, но он не поддерживает свою жену. Дилшода всегда сама старается справляться со своими проблемами. Она очень благодарна своим родителям, что они дали ей возможность научиться шить платья у портнихи. Она шьет очень красивые платья и имеет своих клиентов.  С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами  3 года назад она начала свой бизнес. До этого бизнеса она была трудовым мигрантом в Российской Федерации, но не смогла найти нормальную работу.  Данное время она шьет платья у себя дома. Благодаря  хорошему сервису, она обладает широким кругом клиентов. Ее клиенты женщины со вкусом и очень трудно их удовлетворять, но Дилшода с легкостью справляется с их капризами. Будущим у нее большие планы. Она хочет открыть свое ателье и работать новыми дизайнами и фасонами. Она нуждается новой швейной машинки, но ее доход не позволяет ей купить это. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2500  сомони для покупки новой швейной машинки. Она надеется на вас и вашу доброту.
texts.en: Dilshoda is 26 years old, married, and has 3 children. Her husband is a businessman, but he does not support his wife. Dilshoda always tries to cope with her problems on her own. She is very grateful to her parents for giving her the opportunity to learn how to sew from a seamstress. Now she sews beautiful dresses and has her own clients. For the purpose of providing her family with all the necessities, 3 years ago she started her own business. Prior to that, she had been a migrant worker in the Russian Federation but was unable to find acceptable work. Dilshoda currently works from home sewing dresses, and thanks to her good service, she has a good number of clients. These clients are women of good taste who are very particular and can be difficult to please, but Dilshoda easily manages to satisfy their demands. She has big plans for the future. She wants to open her own sewing studio and work with new designs and styles. She needs a new sewing machine, but her income is not sufficient for her to be able to afford one. Dilshoda is seeking a loan of 2,500 Tajikistan Somoni to buy a new sewing machine. Her hopes are on you and your kindness.

loans.use: To buy sewing machine to develop her business

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en: Mercedes believes that "a hard-working person will have a bright future". She is 49 years old and has four adult-age children. She is now a widow but she has the determination to uplift their status of living. She became involved in hog-raising business to generate additional income. She aims to improve the business to generate sufficient income and satisfy their necessities and save some for future emergencies. She plans to raise more pigs to sell in the community but she has not enough capital. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of P29,000 to buy feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise. Despite hardships and difficulties in life, she believes that she is going to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise

loans.name: Gelegjamts

texts.en:
Mr. Gelegjamts is married and 35 years old. He lives in a 'ger', a Mongolian traditional felt tent, with his wife, son and mother. He works as a guardian at the Korean embassy of Mongolia, and his wife works as a cook at a small kitchen. 

Gelegjamts decided to build a cozy house next spring, thus he needs to purchase wood and other necessary materials. During the winter season the temperature is very changeable and sometimes it hits -40 C. As head of his family, he really wants to create very warm, safe, comfortable living conditions for his lovely family.

loans.use: to purchase wood to build a house

loans.name: Ron

texts.en:
Ron is 49 years old. She is married and resides with nine children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been employed as a worker who cuts down trees for more than ten years, earning approximately $5 daily. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $3 each day. Two of her children are employed. They earn about $6 per day. 
In order to improve her family’s finances, Ron requests a loan of $1000 to purchase farmland to use for farming. This purchase will help her earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her farming business and help her children earn a higher education. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to use for farming

loans.name: Jeannette Del Carmen

texts.es:
Jeannette, solicita un nuevo préstamo para invertir en el negocio, realizando la compra de productos para la elaboración de comida en esta época navideña, se comprara, pollo en su mayor parte y tambien condimentos, ya que lo prepara empanizado para venderlo.
Ella considera que estos préstamos le han permitido incrementar las ganancias y fortalecido el negocio, con esto se ha mantenido trabajando, en su familia sus condiciones económicas han mejorado.
texts.en: Jeannette is requesting a new loan to invest in the business.  She will buy ingredients to prepare food for the Christmas season.  She will mostly buy chicken and condiments since she breads it and sells it.  She considers that these loans have made it possible for her to increase profits and strengthened the business; she’s been able to continue working and her family’s economic conditions have improved.

loans.use: to buy chicken and condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice farm

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a fresh fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling dried fish.  Josephine is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Empresarias Group

texts.es:
Buenos días
Con ustedes el grupo “Mujeres Empresarias” conformada por 09 mujeres emprendedoras y entusiastas que pasan a su 5to ciclo, siendo Gladys es una de las integrantes, ella está ubicada en la parte posterior, es la tercera del lado izquierdo y viste polo manga corta floreado. Gladys de 56 años es casada y tiene 02 hijos uno de ellos en etapa escolar. Gladys se dedica a  la venta de lencerías, todo comenzó cuando trabajaba en una tienda de lencerías, con la experiencia que adquirió y el buen uso que le dio a sus ingresos pudo emprender su propio negocio. Gracias  a su trabajo puede seguir apoyando a su hijo en su educación. Su mayor deseo es de poner su tienda de lencerías en un lugar más comercial. Solicito el crédito para la compra de ropa interior, brasieres y medias. Agradece a los prestamistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada ya que hace posible su progreso.
texts.en:
Good day to you. The group "Mujeres Empresarias" [Enterprising Women] is comprised of 9 entrepreneurial and enthusiastic women passing to their 5th cycle. Gladys is one of the members and is in the back row; she is the third from the left side and is wearing a short-sleeved floral shirt.

Gladys is 56 years old, married, and has 2 children, one of whom is school-aged. Gladys makes a living selling lingerie. It all began when she was working in a lingerie store. With the experience she acquired and the good use of her income she was able to start her own business. Thanks to her work she can continue supporting her son in his education. Her greatest wish is to move her lingerie store to a more commercial location. 

She solicited the credit to buy underwear, bras, and socks. She thanks Kiva lenders for their support since it makes her progress possible.

loans.use: to buy underwear, bras, and socks

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
La señora Rosa maría  soltera vive en  Managua Nicaragua trabaja en el área de contabilidad de una empresa desde hace 22 años.

Doña rosa solicita un crédito ya que necesita hacer la inversión de  compra de zinc, perlines ,por que  considera que es necesario el cambio de techo de su vivienda  para mejor las condiciones de su casa de habitación.
Rosa maría espera  se le haga efectivo dicha solicitud de crédito
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa María is a single woman. She lives in Managua, Nicaragua, and has been working for 22 years as an accountant for a company.

Mrs. Rosa is requesting a loan because she needs to invest in zinc sheets and purlins. She thinks that it is necessary to change the roof of her house in order to improve its condition.

Rosa María hopes to receive this loan.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheets and purlins.

loans.name: Jose Gilberto

texts.es:
José, tiene 44 años de edad, trabaja en la agricultura sembrando maíz de regadillo, tambien realiza trabajos de albañilería, con estas actividades ha logrado mantener a su familia, lo realiza desde hace 10 años, trabaja en lo propio, aprendió con su padre quien tambien trabaja la tierra.
Actualmente se encuentra realizando la siembra de la temporada, para esto solicita un préstamo para comprarse abono seis sacos y pago de mano de obra, con esto esta aumentado la capacidad en el cultivo, con la aspiración de obtener una buena cosecha.
José tiene el objetivo de mejorar las condiciones de su familia, espera a través del trabajo poder realizarlo, ofreciendo una vida mejor a la familia.
texts.en: José, 44, works in agriculture growing irrigated corn; he also works in construction.  He’s able to support his family with these activities.  He’s been doing them for ten years and works for himself; he learned from his father who also worked the land.  He’s currently doing the planting for this season and needs a loan to buy six sacks of manure and to pay labor costs.  With this, he will increase production capacity hoping to have a good harvest.  José’s objective is to improve his family’s conditions and hopes to accomplish this by means of his work offering his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy six sacks of manure and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy silk threads and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Alberto Mauricio

texts.es:
Alberto, tiene 28 años de edad, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y tambien trabaja en estructuras metálicas, con estas ocupaciones ha logrado tener lo necesario para la familia, aprendió con sus padres, tiene dos años de realizarlo en lo propio, de lunes a sábado de 7:00am a 4:00pm es su horario.
Solicita un préstamo para el pago de mano de obra para poder sacar la cosecha de maíz, tambien pagara por el servicio de una maquina desgranadora, este crédito le brindara lo necesario para realizar la parte final del cultivo.
La aspiración que tiene Alberto es aumentar la capacidad del cultivo, para mejorar las cosechas, tambien quiere tener mejores oportunidades para que las condiciones económicas en su familia sean mejor.
texts.en: Alberto, 28, lives with his wife and two children.  He works growing corn and also making metallic structures.  With these occupations he’s been able to have what’s necessary for his family. He learned from his parents and has been working for himself for two years, Monday through Saturday from 7am until 4pm.  He’s requesting a loan to pay labor costs to gather the corn harvest and also to pay for the use of a threshing machine.  This loan will provide what’s needed for him to complete the final growing phase.  Alberto’s wish is to increase crop yields to improve crops and also to have better opportunities so his family’s economic conditions will be better.

loans.use: to pay labor costs and for a thresher.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with five children who are too old to be in school. She is looking after her grandchildren.

Edith has been selling charcoal from door to door at both retail and wholesale prices for six years, working six days a week. She also has rental houses for additional income.

She has requested a loan of UShs 2,000,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more  bags of charcoal for sale. Her challenges include seasonality and late payments. Her dream is to accumulate profits to enable her to build more houses to rent out. She joined MCDT to access credit and save money. She stays in her own house with access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with seven children and all of them attend school. She is not looking after additional members of the family.
She has been selling charcoal in the market at retail for five years, working seven days a week. She also collects rent from her houses as additional income.
She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to enable her to stock more sacks of charcoal for sale. Rose's challenges include seasonality and transportation of bags of charcoal. 
Rose's dream is to be able to stock charcoal that fills a lorry and also to become a wholesaler. She lives in her husband`s house with access to electricity and no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children and three of them are attending school. She also looks after her sibling.
She has been selling green bananas in the market at retail for ten years, working seven days a week. Nuru does not have any other source of income. 
She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to buy more bunches of  green bananas for sale. 
Nuru's challenges include seasonality. Her dream is to be a wholesaler. 
She joined MCDT because of their interest in working with the low income earning group of people. She stays in her own house without access to either electricity or piped water.  Nuru's major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Jonave

texts.en:
Jonave is 26 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like snack foods, sugar, milk, and spices.

Jonave has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from fishing.

Jonave aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like snack foods, sugar, milk, and spices.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle is 29 years old, married and the mother of four children. Three of her children attend school while she works very hard at her food-making business in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more of the ingredients she needs to make food. Michelle has been in this business for five years. Her goal for the future is to save enough money to provide for the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-selling business.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Srey is 19 years old. She is married and lives with her husband in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is a traditional dancer who makes an income of $5 daily. Her husband is employed in a restaurant. He earns about $3 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Srey requests a loan of $1000 to purchase a 'tuk tuk' (motorcycle taxi) for her husband to use to run a taxi service. By doing so, he would generate more income for the family. In the future, Srey would like to run a souvenir shop and build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a 'tuk tuk' (motorcycle taxi) for her husband

loans.name: Junifen

texts.en:
Junifen is a responsible father who is raising his family in a rural community. He is 51 years old and has two adult-age children. He aims to improve their poor living conditions in order to give his family a better life. Aside from farming, he also engages in hog-raising business to generate additional income. 

Due to financial difficulty, he aims to improve the business to earn a higher income. In this regard, he is requesting a loan of P18,000 to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines needed in hog-raising. He is hoping that this loan will help him to make the business viable in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines needed in hog-raising

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de enchiladas y tostadas, tiene 54 años de edad, está viviendo con su esposo,  tiene 6 años de estar realizando ventas las cuales hace tres veces por semana de 8:00am a 4:00pm.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de aceite, plátanos, yuca, que son los necesarios para realizar la venta, aparte de condimentos y otros productos que antevienen en la preparación de la venta, su aspiración es fortalecer el negocio, mejorando la calidad de los productos.
La aspiración de María es vivir mejor con su esposo, tener más comodidades y trabajo para superarse.
texts.en:
Maria makes a living selling enchiladas and tostadas. She is 54 years old and is living with her husband. She has 6 years of experience making sales, which she does three times per week from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. 

She requests a loan for the purchase of oil, bananas, and yucca, which are the necessities for her to make sales, aside from condiments and other products that are used in the preparation of her products. 

Her aspiration is to strengthen her business, improving the quality of her products. Maria's aspiration is to live better with her husband, and to have more amenities and work to better herself.

loans.use: To buy oil, bananas, and yucca.

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Saroeun (in the photo) and his wife, Ngon, are rice and lotus farmers. Saroeun has previously asked for a Kiva loan (www.kiva.org/lend/353299). He is now asking for another in the amount of 700 USD to continue his farming business by buying seed, fertilizer, and pesticide.

The couple has been married since 1991 and they have four children: two sons and two daughters. All of them are in school. They live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en: Maricris is 28 years old, married and the mother of three children. She earns a living by growing rice in the Philippines, and is requesting a loan for PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She has been in this business for three years and earns additional income by running general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: José Isaac

texts.es:
El joven José Isaac vive  en Managua Nicaragua soltero trabaja como lector de medidor  de agua  en una empresa  situada en Managua.

José solicita su crédito  para invertir en materiales de construcción como bloques, cemento, arena para la construcción de un muro en  la parte del frente de su vivienda ya que con esta construcción va a tener mayor seguridad  en su casa de habitación
texts.en:
Young Jose Isaac lives in Managua, Nicaragua.  He is single, and works as a water meter reader for a company located in Managua.

Jose is requesting a loan to invest in construction materials, such as cement blocks, cement, and sand, to build a wall around the front of his house.  By building this wall, he will make his home more secure.

loans.use: to buy cement blocks, cement and sand

loans.name: Noeun

texts.en: Noeun is 44 years old, widowed and lives with her two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. For the last four years, she has earned a living by sewing clothes at home and earns approximately $8 daily. In order to improve her business, Noeun is requesting a loan for $300 to buy of the more material she needs to make clothing. Her goal is to earn more income for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children go to college and earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to buy cloth to use to make clothing.

loans.name: Kifhly

texts.en:
Kifhly is 34 years old, married, and has two children who attend school.  He lives in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.  Kifhly and his wife have been buying and selling cosmetics and kitchenware for four years. They buy cosmetics and kitchenware from the Phnom Penh market and sell them in their local market. 

Kifhly is requesting a loan for $1,000, which he will use to buy more cosmetics and kitchenware to sell.  He hopes to expand his business, which he will enable him to earn more income and better support his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics and kitchenware to sell.

loans.name: Guillermo Antonio

texts.es: El señor Guillermo Antonio  vive en Managua  padre de familia   responsable , con muchos deseos de superación para su familia es por eso que hace dicha solicitud de crédito para  invertirlo en materiales de construcción como cemento, piedra cantera , hierro, para  el anexo de un cuarto que necesita para  mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Mr Guillermo Antonio lives in Managua.  He is a responsible father with strong desires to get his family ahead.  For this reason he is requesting a loan that will be invested in the purchase of construction material such as cement, gravel, iron, for the addition of a room to his house which will improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as blocks, cement and sand.

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Victorina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a local eatery business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years.

Victorina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients and utensils for her local eatery business.

In the future, Victorina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and utensils for her local eatery business.

loans.name: Merlelyn

texts.en:
Merlelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 11 years.  She earns additional income  from motorcycle transport. 

Merlelyn is requesting a loan from NWTF for 29,500 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.  She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She hopes to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant  business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sand, cement, tile and metal grilles.

loans.name: Maria Virginia

texts.es:
María, tiene 35 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos, vive con su esposo y en compañía de sus suegros, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras, refrescos y pupusas, tiene dos años de estar en este negocio lo aprendido por iniciativa propia y trabaja cuatro días por semana.

Ella solicita un préstamo para invertir al negocio y poderlo fortalecer con frutas frescas para realizar los refrescos también comprara azúcar, dentro de las frutas está la piña, manzanas, sandía, que son las que utiliza para hacer los refrescos naturales este préstamo le ayudará brindándole el dinero necesario para poder fortalecer el negocio.

Su aspiración es con la inversión del crédito poder mejorar sus condiciones económicas en la familia, que le permitan tener trabajo permanente para poder proveer lo necesario.
texts.en: María, 35, is the mother of two children.  She lives with her husband and parents-in-law.  She works selling vegetables, beverages and pupusas [filled, grilled corncakes] and has been in business two years having learned on her own initiative and she works four days a week.  She’s requesting a loan to invest in the business and to be able to strengthen it with fresh fruit to make her beverages; she also wants to buy sugar and among the fruits will be pineapple, apples and watermelon which are the ones she uses to make the natural beverages.  This loan will help her have the necessary money to strengthen the business.  Her hope is that by investing the loan she will be able to improve her family’s economic conditions that will make it possible for her to have permanent employment in order to provide what’s necessary.

loans.use: to buy sugar, pineapple, apples and watermelons.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed for his pigs

loans.name: Cenelia Elizabeth

texts.es: La  señora cenelia  es maestra de educación  primaria, está ubicada en el colegio Rural donde se traslada a impartir clases a 25 kilómetros, tiene 19 años de laborar en dicha actividad, es soltera, esta señora tiene la necesidad de construir su vivienda, por  eso decidió visitar  ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un financiamiento y mejorar las condiciones  y nivel de vida, por el cual merece el apoyo para que realice tan hermoso sueño como es de tener su casa propia y disfrutarla al máximo, agradeciéndole a ceprodel y a los inversionistas de kiva por tan oportuno crédito y por beneficiar a personas de bajos recursos.
texts.en:
Cenelia is an elementary school teacher in a rural school she travels 25 kilometers to for her classes.  She has worked for 19 years in this job and is single.

She needs to build her house so she decided to visit CEPRODEL for a loan to improve her living conditions and standard of living.  She needs support to realize such a beautiful dream as having her own house and enjoying it to the maximum degree.

She's grateful to CEPRODEL and the Kiva lenders for such a timely loan and for benefitting low-income people.

loans.use: to buy beams, metal roofing, cement, sand, doors, windows, red brick, anticorrosive, and thinner, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Dulamdorj

texts.en:
Dulamdorj is a 48-year-old woman who has three children, ages 14 to 25, and lives with her family in an outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia, without basic infrastructure. Her two daughters attend a local high school, while her son and his spouse work as a machinist and a builder. 

Since 1995, she has been operating a clothing sales business in the second largest outdoor market of Mongolia. She sells a wide range of clothes imported from Beijing and Ereen, a border city of China, where she travels once or twice in a month. 

She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes to sell for the upcoming season in order to increase her current working capital.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children and both of them attend school. She is looking after a niece.

Harriet has been operating a clinic for humans for ten years, working seven days a week. She also keeps poultry and practices agriculture for side income.

She has requested a loan of UShs 2,000,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more drugs and replace depreciated equipment. Her challenges include high transport costs and recovering payment from debtors. 

Harriet's dream is to own a bigger clinic and employ nurses and other staff. She joined MCDT because interest charged on loans is relatively low. She lives in a rented house with access to both electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses are rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more drugs and replace old equipment

loans.name: Merna

texts.en:
Merna is 37 years old and married with seven children. Merna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like candies, bread, canned goods, eggs, etc.

Merna has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Merna aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like candies, bread, canned goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with two children and both of them attend school. She is not looking after other members of her family. She has been operating a hair salon for seven years, working seven days a week. She does not have any other source of income.

teopista has requested a loan of UShs 2,000,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock synthetic hair, hair oils, chemicals, and skin oils.
