She operates a farm where she sells cabbages, tea, coffee, tomatoes, etc. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a conducive business environment and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She also runs a dairy farming business where she sells milk, which adds to her business income.

Jecinta will use her KES 20,000 loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer. Her goal is to improve her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will buy an acre of land. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy seedling and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of food stuff such as beans, rice, flour, etc.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with five children, three of whom attend school. She is also looking after her grandchildren. She rents a house with no access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses are rent and school fees. 

Rose has been selling charcoal from home at retail for the last six years, working seven days a week. She does not have an additional source of income. She has requested a loan of UGX 800,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her buy more sacks of charcoal for sale. Her challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her dream is to expand her business and start a wholesale operation. Rose joined MCDT to boost her business.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with eight children, all of whom attend school. She is also looking after her mother. She lives in a rented house with access to electricity but no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses are rent and school fees.

Juliet has been operating  a restaurant  in the market for 10 years, working seven days a week. She does not have any other source of income. She has requested a loan of UGX 500,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her stock more rice, Irish potatoes, flour and charcoal. Her challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her dream is to own a restaurant. She joined MCDT because of their interest in raising the standard of living of women by encouraging them to do business.

loans.use: To buy more rice, Irish potatoes, flour, and charcoal

loans.name: Agenes

texts.en: Agenes is 48 years old and widowed with two children.  She runs a pharmacy to earn a living. She has been in the business for five years.  She has employed one person in the business.  She also runs a MPESA (mobile phone money transfer) business.  Through Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save her money because she has been trained in financial management. She hopes to grow her business in the future.  She needs a loan of 20,857 KES to buy medicine.

loans.use: To buy medicine

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en: Dennis is a new client in the institution who has been provided with a loan of 1,000,000 shillings to buy pesticides. He is a single man; however, he has three dependents that he takes care of. He pays their school fees, and provides clothes and other necessities. Dennis has been involved in tomato farming and trading for the last six years. Most of his customers are schools, individuals and retail shops and kiosks from neighboring markets and districts. His biggest problems are limited capital, lack of storage facilities for his products (since they are perishable), pests, and diseases. But with this loan he will be in a position to solve most of them.

loans.use: To buy pestcides

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya. He is a married father of two school-going children. He operates a fruit stall which has been running for four years, and where he sells bananas, oranges, etc. He also has other employment. Despite the challenge of perishability and bad debts, he aspires to own a larger structure from which he can sell his food. 

Daniel learned about Milango from his friends and is applying for a loan of 15,900 Kenyan shillings to purchase additional stock of fruit such as bananas, oranges, etc. He also wants to move to a new venue, carry out good business and establish a hotel in the future. Daniel believes the additional income from this loan will help him provide a good education to his children.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of fruit such as bananas, oranges, etc.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, all of whom attend school. She is not looking after any other member of the family. She lives in a rented house with no access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

Margaret has been operating an eating establishment in a market for ten years, working six days a week. She does not have any other source of income. She has requested a loan of UGX 500,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more rice, flour, cooking oil, and charcoal, and to replace some saucepans. Her challenges include recovering payments from debtors and unstable food prices. Her dream is to own a big restaurant. She joined MCDT because she wanted her business to grow.

loans.use: to stock more rice, flour, cooking oil, and charcoal, and to replace some saucepans

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 34 years old, married, and has a three-year-old child.  He does farming to earn a living and mainly grows vegetables.  He has been farming for seven years and has grown his business through the financial support from Faulu Kenya.

John hopes to practice large-scale farming in the future.  He needs a loan of 15,643 KES to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold lives in Mombasa, Kenya.  He is married and has three children, one of whom is in school.  He runs a private primary school, which has been operating for three years, and he employs two other teachers.  Besides this, he also owns a tailor shop. 

He learned of Milango from his friends and is now applying for a loan of 21,100 KES to buy physical education uniforms.  The only challenge he faces is capital shortage needed for hiring additional teachers and for paying the high cost of licensing.  Arnold’s future ambition is to own a fully-fledged school with upper primary facilities.  He will save the extra income to pay for his children’s school fees.

loans.use: to pay for physical education uniforms.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children, and three of them attend school. She is also looking after her sibling.

Farida has been selling yellow bananas at retail from home for the last eight years, working seven days a week. She also earns income from rental houses. She has requested a loan of UGX 500,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her buy more bunches of sweet bananas for sale. Her challenges include seasonality. 

Her dream is to capture a bigger market in her area and accumulate profits for bigger projects. She joined MCDT because it was easy for her to become a member. She lives in her husband's house with access to electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of sweet bananas

loans.name: Tufaa

texts.en:
Tufaa is a resident of Mariakani area of Coast province in Kenya. She is married and has five children. Tufaa owns a retail shop, a business that she has been running for three years. She began the business from a loan she obtained from a friend. In this shop, she sells products like sugar, flour, and cereals. 

Tufaa began the business from a mobile setting, moving from house to house. She learned about Milango from other clients and joined the institution with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is price fluctuations.    

Tufaa is applying for a loan of 73,050 Kenyan shillings to purchase more inventory items like sugar, flour, and cereals. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve her living standard. She aspires to own other retail centers and to plan for her children’s education with much security.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, flour, cereals and other items for sale.

loans.name: Bonheur 1 Group

texts.en:
Regis, age 33, is single and has a 2-year-old daughter. He is representing the Bonheur 1 group. He owns a business where he sells items for events, such as tents, plastic chairs, and projectors. He has been operating this business for two years. He will use the loan to buy plastic chairs to replenish his stock. His business strategy is to market everywhere in his community. He puts up flyers telling anyone who is planning an event that he has chairs, tents, and other things for a good price.

Regis has received four previous loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. He has a good repayment record. His dream is to buy a venue and rent it out for concerts and other events. He wants his little girl to stay in school and have a good education.

loans.use: to pay for plastic chairs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Genesiu

texts.en: Genesiu is 30 years old, married and has two children. He runs a motorbike transport business to earn a living. He has been in the business for three years. He says that his hard work has enabled him to retain his business. Genesiu hopes to expand his business and employ people. He needs a loan of 74,013 KES to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Olger Danilo

texts.es: Olger Danilo, tiene la edad  de 54 años, está en unión libre, vive con su hija y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de otra en trabajos de asistencia para el café. Además de poder comprar unas plantas de almácigo para realizar resiembras y así aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias  en próximas cosechas y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Olger Danilo, 54, lives in a common-law marriage with his wife and daughter, who are his biggest priority.

With his loan he plans to buy fertilizer and fungicide and to pay for labor to prepare the coffee.  He also wants to buy some seedlings to replant and increase the plant density in the area, as well as make the most of the soil fertility and climate and other conditions that favor coffee production.

With these improvements to his crop he hopes to get some profits in the next harvests.  This way he can improve his family's living conditions as well as invest more in the crop and also achieve some goals.

This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR. Previously, he had not had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR offered him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to prepare the coffee crop

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a resident of the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a married mother of two school-aged children and runs a clothes shop, a business that she has been operating for nine years. Besides this, she also runs some rental houses.

Flora learned about Milango through an employee and joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are competition and bad debts. She believes that with this loan, she can improve the business.

Flora is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to purchase clothes. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve on her living standard. She aspires to be a large scale supplier of second hand clothes.

loans.use: To purchase clothes.

loans.name: Bonheur 2 Group

texts.en:
Gisele, age 39, is married with five children, ages 7 to 19 years old. She has four children currently attending school. She also cares and provides for her husband's child. Gisele is representing the Bonheur 2 group. She has a drink depot where she sells a variety of soft drinks. She has had this business for two years. She will use the loan to buy more drinks to replenish her store. The majority of soft drinks in Congo are still sold in glass bottles. Customers bring their empty glass bottles to a vendor and buy full bottles. Her business strategy is to travel to her customers and pick up empty bottles and bring them full bottles. 

Gisele has received four previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. She has a good repayment record. She wants to continue to grow her business. She hopes that all of her children will finish school.

loans.use: to pay for soft drinks.

loans.name: Ken

texts.en:
Ken is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya.  He is a married businessman who owns a butchery, a trade that he has run for about a year.  He learned of Milango from a friend and joined in order to access funds.  He is applying for a loan in the amount of 21,100 Kenyan shillings in order to add stock to the butchery (beef and poultry meat). 

The only challenges in the business are strong competition and the lack of an adequate meat supply.  But Ken is determined to carry out his operations well because he believes this venture can help establish his family.  His future ambition is to be able to open other stalls/shops.

loans.use: to add stock to his butchery, such as beef and poultry meat.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a resident of Kilifi, Kenya. He is a single businessman and owns a shop selling diesel and petrol. This business has been running for five years. He is also involved in clothing sales. 

Thomas learned of Milango from his friends, and joined the group to access funds for his business. 

Thomas is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings to purchase petrol and diesel for sale. His main challenges are scarcity, high cost of fuel and price fluctuations. He looks forward to setting up his own business someday instead of renting. He also wants to open another fuel outlet and add to his clothing stock.

loans.use: To purchase petrol and diesel for sale

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 40 years old, married, and has four children. He repairs motorbikes and bicycles to earn a living. He also farms for more income generation. Edward has grown his businesses since joining Faulu Kenya, because he has been trained on business management.

Edward is seeking a loan of 84,442 Kenyan Shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John lives in Kongowea, Kenya. He owns a music studio that has been running for one year. From this shop, John sells music compact discs and audio tapes. He is also employed at a restaurant and manages a cereal shop. 

John dreams of owning a larger music studio offering video coverage and editing services. The setbacks in this business are competition from other established players and the lack of capital for expansion, an issue he sees partly solved with this loan.

He is applying for a loan of 26,300 Kenyan Shillings to improve the operations at the studio, including the purchase of additional compact discs.

loans.use: To purchase a more compact discs for his business

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina, 49 years old, is a farmer who grows potatoes. She has been farming for over ten years; she also raises livestock. Regina is very hard-working and, since joining Faulu Kenya, she has learned to save her money for future purposes. 

She wishes to be a successful dairy farmer someday, and to also expand the cow shed. She is requesting a loan of 20,857 Kenyan Shillings to buy fertilizer, seedlings and farm inputs for the soil.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings, and farm inputs

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry, age 36, is a farmer who has been in business for five years. He is very hard-working and, since joining Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money and manage his farm.

Henry hopes to become a successful businessman and buy a piece of land to expand his farming activities. He is requesting a loan of 53,156 Kenyan Shillings to buy more fruit, vegetable and cabbage seedlings.

loans.use: to buy more fruit, vegetable and cabbage seedlings

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac grows animal feed on his family farm in the state of Mexico and sells small quantities of milk. He is investing in a 12 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester in order to reduce costs and take advantage of the abundant and readily-available manure his animals produce. His biodigester will process the waste and turn it into valuable resources. With the organic fertilizer produced by the system, Isaac will produce his feed more cheaply, increasing profits. Furthermore, he and his family will use the renewable biogas generated for cooking and heating water, displacing expensive, non-renewable LP gas. This loan represents 50% of the total price of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase a 12 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Kakhi

texts.en:
Kakhi lives in the town of Kutaisi. He is 30 years old, married, and lives with his wife and 7-year-old son. Kakhi is, at the moment, unemployed. The only source of income for the family is the small income earned by Kakhi, who is involved in a frits trading business. The family lives in poverty. According to Credo estimations, they belong to the vulnerable poor category. 

Kakhi decided to start his business as their existing income isn’t enough for the family and their living conditions are poor. His loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provisions of a business start-up and restartup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Kakhi will purchase a metal and plastic workshop. He will produce doors and windows and sell them at a good price as demand is high in the region. Kakhi hopes that his new business initiative will be profitable and this will increase the family income. With the increased income, Kakhi will improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase metal and plastic workshop.

loans.name: Xiomara Yamileth

texts.es:
Xiomara, vive con su familia, su esposo y dos hijos, se dedica a la crianza de pollos, este negocio comenzó por iniciativa propia, lo tiene en su casa de habitación, no tiene un horario establecido y mucha experiencia para atender el negocio.

Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de 350 pollitos para engordarlos además les comprará vitaminas y alimento (concentrado), este crédito le ayudará a crecer y a tener más amplia la granja permitiéndole a aumentar las ventas.

El objetivo de Xiomara es tener un negocio bien establecido con mejores ingresos, ya que esto le permitirá darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Xiomara lives with her family, her husband and two children.  She raises chickens, started this business on her own, and runs it out of her home.  She doesn’t have a set schedule and she has lots of experience in this field.
 

She is asking for a loan to buy 350 chicks to raise.  She will also buy vitamins and feed (concentrated).  This loan will help her grow her business and expand her farm so that she can increase her sales.
 

Xiomara’s goal is to have a good business with better revenue because this will allow her to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María, se dedica al cultivo de maíz, actualmente está realizando el proceso de preparación de la cosecha, solicita un préstamo para pagar mano de obra y poder desgranar el maíz, permitiéndole tenerlo listo para la alimentación y para venderlo.

Ella considera que estos préstamo le han permitido un aumento en la producción de maíz y al mismo tiempo ha logrado vender para obtener dinero, le ha dado una mejor condición de vida a ella y a sus hijos cubriendo algunas necesidades de salud y alimentación.
texts.en:
María raises corn and is currently preparing for her harvest.  She is asking for a loan to pay for labor to remove the corn from the cobs so that she can store and sell it.

She believes that this loan has allowed her to increase her corn production and at the same time allowed her to sell it to obtain money.  She has provided a better quality of life for her children and provided them with good health and food.

loans.use: to pay for farm labor.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, vive con sus hijos y nietos, sus hijos le ayudan trabajando y también su esposo, cubriendo la necesidad del hogar, ella administra un comedor donde vende comida desde hace 10 años, en este negocio toda la familia ayuda tratando de atender bien a la clientela.

Ella solicita un préstamo y para realizar la compra de materia prima como es aceite, frijoles, carne, condimento, y también algunos plásticos necesarios para la venta de la comida como platos desechables, entre otros, esto le ayudará para mejorar la atención al cliente facilitándole el proceso para preparar la comida.

Su objetivo es tener un comedor en un local más grande, que sea rentable al mismo tiempo poner una pequeña tienda.
texts.en:
Isabel lives with her children and grandchildren.  Her children and her husband help her in her work and in covering the household necessities.  She runs a restaurant where she has been selling food for the past 10 years and the whole family helps out to try to serve customers.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy ingredients such as cooking oil, beans, meat, condiments, and also some plastic items such as disposable plates and other things.  This will help her serve customers better and make it easier to prepare the food. 

Her goal is to have a bigger restaurant that is profitable.  She also wants to open a small store.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children - two of them attend school. She stays in her husband`s house with access to both electricity and piped water. She is not looking after any additional members of the family. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

She has been selling basic commodities at retail for 11 years, working 7 days a week. She also hires out her motorcycle for additional income. Her challenges include transportation. 

Adela has requested a loan of UShs 2,700,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, rice, maize flour, baking powder, Irish potatoes, soda, and cooking oil for sale. 

She joined MCDT because of low interest and timely loans. Her dream is to grow her business and become a wholesaler and also to open a second shop.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, rice, maize flour, baking powder, Irish potatoes, soda, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando, es ganadero, tiene 43 años de edad, vive con sus dos hijos uno de 15 años y el otro de 22 años trabajan junto a él, la ganadería es la compra de ganado lechero y la venta de los productos, como la leche y queso, es un negocio de familia y trabaja de lunes a sabado.

Solicita un préstamo para comprar ganado y concentrado, físicamente una vaquilla y también los sacos de concentrado, que le permitirán ayudar la alimentación del ganado y aumentar su numero, esto será un beneficio para ir aumentando el ganado lechero.

El objetivo de Orlando es fortalecer el negocio y ofrecer una mejor condición a sus hijos a través del trabajo.
texts.en:
Orlando raises livestock.  He’s 43 years old and lives with his two children, ages 15 and 22.  They work with him, buying dairy livestock and selling the products such as milk and cheese.  It’s a family business and he works Monday through Saturday

He is asking for a loan so that he can buy livestock and increase the size of his heard.  He wants to buy a cow and also sacks of concentrated feed so he can feed them and increase their number.  This will give him more dairy cows.

Orlando’s objective is to strengthen his business and provide his children with better living conditions through work.

loans.use: to buy a cow and feed.

loans.name: Fany Margarita

texts.es:
Fanny, quiere surtir el negocio con más productos para la temporada, invirtiendo en la compra de insumos para los licuados y para la bisutería, se comprará pulseras, aretes, y para la elaboración de los licuados leche, naranjas, Zapotes, azúcar, que son los necesarios diariamente.

Ella manifiesta que el efecto que le dio el préstamo anterior al negocio fue positivo, ya que logró mejorar el local y comprar productos para la venta, además compró pintura para pintar el negocio, con esto ella manifiesta que ha mantenido su nivel de ingresos para el hogar deseando suplirlo más con otro tipo de productos.
texts.en:
Fanny wants to stock her store with more seasonal products, buy more supplies for her smoothies and buy costume jewelry.  She will buy bracelets, crafts, and ingredients, such as milk, oranges, zapotes, and sugar for her smoothies.  She uses these items daily.

She says that her previous loan was very positive and allowed her to improve her business.  It allowed her to improve her eatery and buy products to sell.  She also bought paint to paint the business, so that she can maintain her level of income, but she wants to supplement it with other types of products.

loans.use: to buy inventory..

loans.name: Salima

texts.ru: Салима жительница города Худжанд. Ей 36 лет. Она замужем. У нее один ребенок. Салима живет с мужем. Ее муж занимается земледелием. Салима занимается животноводством. Она у себя дома разводит крупнорогатый скот. Этим видом деятельности она занимается десять лет. Салима берет кредит для закупа дойной коровы.
texts.en: Salima is a resident of the town of Khujand. She is 36 years old, married and has one child. Salima lives with her husband. Her husband does land cultivation. Salima does animal husbandry, she breeds large horned cattle at home. She has been in this business for ten years. Salima is taking out the loan to buy a milk cow.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, three of whom attend school. She is not looking after any other family members. She has been selling second hand clothes in the market at retail for four years, working six days a week. She does not earn any additional income.

She has requested a loan of UGX 700,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her buy more bales of used clothes for sale. Her challenges include seasonality and thieves. Her dream is to expand her business and be able to sell at wholesale and also to build her own house. She joined MCDT-SACCO because of timely loans. She stays in a rented house with access to electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses are rent, transport, school fees and water.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with three children, all of whom attend school. She is not looking after any additional family members. She has been selling green bananas in the market at retail for four years and works seven days a week. She also runs a retail shop for basic commodities as another source of income.

She has requested a loan of UGX 800,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her buy more bunches of green bananas for resale. Her challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her dream is to plough her profits back into the business, to expand her business, and also to buy a delivery van to ease in transportation. She joined MCDT because she did not have enough capital. She stays in her own house without access to either electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas for resale.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children and all of them are attending school. She is not looking after any additional family members. She has been selling local gin in the market at wholesale for the last ten years, working seven days a week. She does not earn any additional income.

She has requested a loan of UGX 2,000,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her buy more jerycans of local gin for sale. Her challenges include transportation and defaulters. Her dream is to buy a delivery van to ease in transportation and also to build her own house. She joined MCDT because the loan interest is relatively low. She stays in a rented house with access to electricity but no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more jerycans of local gin for resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, all of whom attend school. She is not looking after any other family members. She has been selling second hand brassieres, night dresses and night pajamas at retail for three years, working six days a week. She does not have any other income.

She has requested a loan of UGX 1,000,000 from MCDT- SACCO to be able to buy more second hand brassieres, night dresses and night pajamas for sale. Her challenges include seasonality, ever increasing prices of used clothes and transportation. Her dream is to get a permanent business premise.  She joined MCDT because of the low interest charged on loans. She stays in a rented house with access to electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include paying rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more second hand brassieres, night dresses and night pajamas.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with eight  children and all of them are attending school. She is also looking after three nephews. She has been selling second-hand clothes in the market at retail for ten  years, working six days a week. She also sells paint, rears chicken and sells piped water to earn more income. 

She has requested a loan of UGX 1,500,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her buy more bales of used clothes like skirts, blouses, trousers, shirts, dresses, and suits for sale. Her challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her dream is to expand the business and accumulate profits to enable her buy land and also to start importing used clothes from Dubai. She joined MCDT because of transparency. She stays in her house with access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto de 56 años, vive solo en una vivienda construida a base de madera. Tiene hijos pero no viven con él. Desde hace 30 años se dedica a la producción integral de cacao orgánico en unas parcelas cuya ubicación esta a 1 hora de caminata desde la localidad donde vive. Para él esta actividad lo considera tranquila sin presiones de terceros.
Gracias a que la parte selva en la que se encuentra, los frutos como cacao crecen de manera óptima logrando convertirse en una buena alternativa de negocio para todos los productores como él. Actualmente dese invertir en su producción con cacao injertado, para eso debe contar con mano de obra de jornaleros, ya conocedores en la técnica, para cumplir la tarea en un menor periodo posible. Adicional a ello debe adquirir sacos de abono orgánico. Uno de sus sueños a futuro es concretar la construcción de su vivienda con material noble para beneficio de sus hijos que actualmente no viven con el, pero sí se encarga por ahora de su educación. Este viene a ser su cuarto crédito con MFP, agradece desde siempre la oportunidad que le brindan para acceder los créditos manteniendo como parte del trato un buen historial crediticio. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles realizará la compra de plantas de cacao para injerto, asimismo contratará jornaleros para agilizar la tarea, adicional a ello comprará también sacos de abono orgánico, para una optima producción.
texts.en:
Roberto, 56, lives alone in a wooden house. He has children, but they do not live with him. He has been growing organic cocoa for thirty years, in a parcel located one hour walking from where he lives. He considers this an easy activity, without pressure from third parties.

Because he lives in a sylvan area, fruits like the ones from the cocoa tree grow optimally, which results in a good business alternative for all producers, like him. He wants to invest in grafted cocoa, and for that he needs to hire day laborers, who know the technique, in order to perform this task as quickly as possible. He also needs to buy compost.

One of his dreams, for the future, is to build his house with solid material, which will benefit his children. He pays for their education, although they do not live with him.

This would be his fourth loan with MFP. He deeply appreciates the opportunity of having access to these loans, and he does his part by keeping a good record. With the 1,000 nuevos soles [PEN] he will buy cocoa plants for grafting, will pay for labor costs and will buy bags of compost for an optimal production.

loans.use: to buy cocoa plants for grafting, to pay for the labor costs and to buy compost for an optimal production.

loans.name: Ritchie

texts.en:
Ritchie earns a living with her sari-sari, or variety store, business. She lives with her husband and her four young children in Bohol, Philippines. Ritchie has been in this business for several years now.

Ritchie is requesting for a loan to buy soda, canned goods, snack food, toiletries, and other goods to sell in her store. 

In the future, Ritchie hopes to expand her business. Any additional revenue generated from it will be used for reinvestment and the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy soda, canned goods, snack food, toiletries, and other goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.en:
Teofilo is a 46 year old married man and a father of four children from Ubay, Bohol.   He earns a living through his tailoring shop.
Teofilo is asking for a loan to buy materials like thread, cloth and needles  for sewing.  With this, he will be able to accept orders and repairs from his customers, which helps increase his income.
Teofilo hopes to expand his business in the future and saves money for his children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy materials like thread, cloth, needles for sewing

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 58 year old married woman  from Ubay, Bohol.  She has two dependent sons ages 17 and 10.   She has been engaged in a sari-sari, or variety store, business for 15 years and her husband works as a fisherman.   
Teresita sells items like toiletries, canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, candles, food snacks etc. to the people in her community.  She earns about 6000 PhP per month with her business.  Teresita is requesting a loan to buy additional stock for her store.

In the future, Teresita dreams to expand her business so that she can support the education of her children and the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her store.  Items like toiletries, canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, candy, food snacks and more.

loans.name: Roel

texts.en:
Roel  lives with his wife and two young children in Ubay, Bohol.  He earns a living through his habal-habal or motorcycle transport business.  He has been in the business for more than 5 years and requests a loan to buy fuel for the motorcycle

Roel is also engaged in mat weaving business.   The loan will also help him buy more materials for mat weaving. 

With this  loan, he will be able to transport more passengers and produce more mats.  In the future, Roel hopes tomake his business a success and save money for his children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy fuel for the motorcycle and materials for mat weaving

loans.name: Zandra

texts.en:
Zandra is a Guatemalan artisan specializing in handcrafted jade jewelry.   She would like to invest in the purchase of jade and silver to increase production.

Zandra has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is her story:

"The first thing I ever made on my own was a pair of silver earrings. My husband taught me so I could help him. As I saw the jewelry I had been crafting and saw how beautiful it was, I felt happy. It has not been easy getting established as an artisan because silver is very expensive and it's difficult to purchase. But when you set your own mind to it, you can achieve your goals. I like to work with jade because it is a sacred stone for us Maya people.  Jade used to be worn as an amulet, and those who wore the most jade pieces where considered to be the most important people in the community. Retaining the value of our traditions is always important."

"To me, this microcredit is an opportunity to develop new designs and afford the materials needed to craft them.  Thank you so much for your support!"

Use the link below to view Zandra's jade jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8030

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of jade and silver to make jewelry.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is a 67-year-old married mother of seven grown-up children from Ubay, Bohol. Rosario is a farmer who has been in the business for more than 30 years now. She works with her husband in tilling their farm lot.

Rosario works hard to support her husband in meeting their needs. 

Rosario's only dream is to improve her family's way of living and expand their farming ventures. However, she lacks the financial resources to do so. Because of this, she has joined CEVI to avail herself of the loan services offered by the organization to micro-entrepreneurs like her. With this loan, Rosario will be able to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides and pay rent on farm equipment, thus enabling her to make great improvements in her farm.

Rosario hopes that one day, she will be able to improve their way of living and experience the fullness of life.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides and pay rent on farm equipment.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina earns a living by selling home-cooked snack foods to the people in her area. She has been in this business for more than a year now. Her husband works as farmer in their area of Ubay, Bohol.

Rosalina gives her best to provide support to her husband, especially in meeting the needs of the family.

As of now, she is asking for a loan to buy sugar, cooking oil, bananas, sweet potatoes, flour and other ingredients for her snack-making business.

In the future, Rosalina wants to expand her business and make it sustainable.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil, bananas, sweet potatoes, flour and other ingredients for her snack-making business.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus is originally from Mexico where he earned an engineering degree. Ten years ago, the company that both he and his wife worked for closed down all operations in Mexico, leaving them both unemployed. They decided to take the plunge and move to the US with their two small children.

Jesus now works as an operator of shipping construction machinery. His sons are now teenagers and his daughter is 7 years old. Not wanting to be dependent on one job, Jesus started a brand new business on top of his full time job.

Blue Party Rentals, named after his daughter Azul (means blue in Spanish), rents out jumpers and jukeboxes for parties. His clients are primarily from the Latino community in San Diego, because he says, “they love to sing.” What Jesus likes about his startup business is the interaction with clients who are generally in the party mood, and that he can mostly run the business during the weekends. 

His Kiva loan will be used to equip his new entertainment business with 3 jumpers and 3 jukeboxes and to pay for liability insurance. Blue Party Rentals started operations in December 2012.

Jesus dreams of growing Blue Party Rentals to make it his primary occupation.  He wants to offer a one-stop-shop for event organizers by also renting out tents, tables, chairs and other party equipment. He hopes to continue providing for his family, and maybe one day even buy a home and send his kids to college.

Find Blue Party Rentals on Facebook at: https://www.facebook.com/pages/BLUE-PARTY-Rentals/262474477123314
Or on the web at: https://sites.google.com/site/bluepartyrentals/

video.title: Kiva Borrower Jesus from United States

loans.use: to purchase 3 jumpers, 3 jukeboxes and pay for liability insurance

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a married woman from Ubay, Bohol.  She has five grown children earns a living through her grocery store which she started two years ago.  Her husband works as a fish vendor.

Nenita needs additional capital for the expansion of her store.  She is requesting a loan from CEVI to buy more stock to like rice, noodles, canned goods, soda, toiletries and soap which she can sell in her store.

In the future, Nenita hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store.  Items like rice, noodles, canned goods, soda, toiletries and soap

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila runs a sari-sari or variety store in Ubay, Bohol.  Her husband works as carpenter.  Lucila works hard to earn a living so that she can support her husband in meeting the needs and expenses of their family.  She has been running the business for more than four years. 

Lucila requests a loan to buy more stock to sell at her store.  Items like rice, soda, canned goods, beverages, snack foods and others.  With this, she can finally have more customers and buyers in her store, thus increasing her sales and profit.

loans.use: to buy more stock.  Items like rice, soda, canned goods, beverages, snack foods and more.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is a married woman and a mother of seven grown up children from Ubay, Bohol.  She has been engaged in a hog raising business for almost 10 years. Felisa wants to expand her business but lacks the financial resources to do so.  

Felisa is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets and feed.  In the future, Felisa wants to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Charmain

texts.en:
Charmain is a 26 year old married woman and a mother of five young children from Ubay, Bohol. She and her husband have been engaged in a fishing business for several years. That is the source of their income.

Charmain is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets and materials for house renovation like wood and nails. In the future, Charmain wants to improve their standard of living, and explore another ventures to increase their earnings.

loans.use: to buy  fishing nets and materials like wood and nails for house renovation

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of a 15-year-old son from Ubay, Bohol. She earns a living by selling home-cooked foods to the people in her place. 

Mercedita is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like sugar, flour, bananas, cooking oil and others. Through this, she will be able to cook more food for her customers.

In the future, Mercedita wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, flour, bananas, cooking oil and others

loans.name: Gorretti

texts.en:
Gorretti lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, three of whom attend school. She is not looking after any additional family members.

She has been selling chips from door to door for three years at retail and works six days a week. She also sells grasshoppers as another source of income.

She has requested for a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more Irish potatoes, cooking oil and charcoal and buy a kettle. Her challenges include seasonality and thieves. Her dream is to be able to build her own house and shift her business there. She joined MCDT for self development. She rents a house without access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more Irish potatoes, cooking oil, charcoal and a kettle.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is a 29-year-old married woman and a mother of two young children from Bohol, Philippines. She owns a 'habal-habal' or motorcycle. Her husband uses it to earn a living. A motorcycle is one way of transporting passengers from one place to another, especially in remote areas.

Nilda needs a loan to buy  new nuts and bolts, a tire and to pay for the repair of the motorcycle. With this, they will be able to maintain the good working condition of the vehicle.

In the future, Nilda aims to improve their way of living and explore other ventures to improve their income.

loans.use: to buy  new nuts and bolts and a tire and pay for repair of the motorcycle

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a married woman and a mother of three young children from Ubay, Bohol. She has a business growing different kinds of crops like rice and bananas. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Melanie needs a loan to buy fuel for her boat and fertilizer and pesticides for her farm. 

In the future, Melanie wants to expand her family's businesses and save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fuel for her boat and fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic runs a grocery store business in her area in Bohol, Philippines. She has been in the business for more than 12 years now. She sells various goods and commodities to the people in her neighborhood.

Marivic is asking for a loan to buy additional noodles, canned goods, soda, chips, snack foods, and additional items to sell. With this merchandise, she will be able to cater and sell more products to her customers and buyers.

In the future, Marivic wants to reinvest in the same business. She also wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional noodles, canned goods, soda, chips, snack foods, and additional items to sell.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children, two of whom attend school. She also looks after her parents.

She has been selling charcoal in the market at retail for seven years, working seven days a week. She does not have an additional source of income.

She has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to enable her buy more sacks of charcoal for sale. Her challenges include high transport costs and seasonality. Her dreams are to expand her business, accumulate profits so she can eventually stop borrowing, and own a delivery van to facilitate transportation. She joined MCDT because she wanted funds to boost her business. She stays in a rented house without access to electricity but with piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Kamida

texts.en:
Kamida lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has three children, all of whom attend school. She is not looking after additional members of the family.

She has operated a retail shop for basic commodities for ten years, working seven days a week. She also sells green bananas as an additional source of income. She has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to buy more salt, sugar, flour, cooking oil, and paraffin for sale. Her challenges include thieves. Her dream is to own a very big shop. She joined MCDT because she wanted to make more profits and friends. She rents a house with access to electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more salt, sugar, flour, cooking oil, and paraffin

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Ubay, Bohol. She runs a grocery store business in her area. Her husband is a farmer.

Marissa aims to improve her store but lacks the capital to do so. For this reason, she is requesting for a loan from CEVI to buy more soda, chips, snack foods, canned goods, rice and other merchandise. 

In the future, Marissa dreams of making her business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more soda, chips, snack foods, canned goods, rice and other merchandise.

loans.name: Ma.luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is a 26-year-old married woman and a mother of a four-year-old child. She earns a living by running her variety store, which sells various goods and commodities to the people in her place.

Ma. Luisa is asking for a loan to buy more canned goods, chips, snack foods, soda, soap, toiletries and other merchandise to sell. With this merchandise, she will be able to attract and cater to more customers in her store.

In the future, Ma. Luisa dreams of expanding her business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, chips, snack foods, soda, soap, toiletries and other merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with seven children, three of whom attend school. She is not looking after additional members of her family.

She has been selling sugar cane in the market at retail for ten years, working six days a week. She does not have an additional source of income.

She has requested for a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to enable her buy more bundles of sugar cane to resell. Her challenges include high transport costs and seasonality. Her dream is to expand her business to wholesale; she also wants to start growing sugar cane. She joined MCDT because she did not have enough capital. She rents a house with access to electricity and no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of sugar cane to resell.

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children who are attending school. She does not look after additional members of the family. She has been selling sweets, books, pens and biscuits by the roadside at retail for 11/2 years, working six days a week. She also operates a canteen as another source of income.

She has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to enable her stock more sweets, pens, books, loaves of bread and biscuits to sell. Her challenges include weather. Her dream is to expand her business and accumulate profits that will enable her to buy land. She joined MCDT because she wanted to increase her capital. She stays in a rented house with access to electricity and no piped water. Her major monthly expenses are rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more sweets, pens, biscuits, cakes, books and loaves of bread.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is a 53-year-old married woman and mother of four adult children from Bohol, Philippines. She has had her own food vending business for more than ten years now. She sells home-cooked foods to the people in her locality.

Guillerma needs additional capital to expand her business. She is asking for a loan to buy more sugar, milk flour and other ingredients for her food vending business. With these ingredients, she will be able to cook and sell more food.

In the future, Guillerma wants to explore another venture to augment her income.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, milk flour and other ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es:
Teodosia de 45 años, comparte un matrimonio al lado de Felipe de 60 años. Ambos muy trabajadores dirigen todos  sus objetivos económicos para su hijo Aldair de 14 años. Desde que inició su matrimonio con Felipe se dedico a la venta de abarrotes al por menor, es así que habilitó el primer piso de su vivienda y logrando poco a poco convertirlo en un buen sustento economico.
Considera su actividad como algo tranquila y a su vez fácil, dentro de los productos que mas demanda posee en su negocio están las verduras y cereales debido a que mantiene contacto directo con productores, quienes proveen de manera inmediata el morón, garbanzos, lentejas y otros cereales, haciendo de su negocio único en su tipo.
Para la temporada de fin de año espera complementar sus productos con la compra de panetones, biscochos y demás víveres ya que es una época donde los comercios locales gozan de buenas ventas y no desea ella ser la excepción.
Sus metas a largo plazo apuntan a lograr culminar el segundo piso de su vivienda a base de material noble para el futuro de su menor hijo y destinarlo también para el alquiler de cuartos. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles que solicita, complementará su negocio con la compra de panetones al por mayor y demás víveres de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Teodosia is 45 years old. She is married to Felipe, who is 60. They both are very hardworking and ai all of their financial objectives at their son, Aldair, who is 14.  Since she married Felipe, she has sold groceries retail. That is why she set up the first floor of her house and little by little converted it into a good source of income. 

She considers her activity to be both calm and easy. Among the products that are most in demand in her business are vegetables and grains, because she maintains direct contact with the growers, who deliver to her directly the peppers, garbanzos, lentils and other grains, making her business unique among others like it.

For the end of the year season, she hopes to complement her products by buying panetones (Christmas bread), cookies and other groceries, since this is the only time of year when local businesses have good sales and she doesn't want to be the exception. 

Her long term goals are finishing the second floor on her brick house for her son's future and also use it to rent out rooms. With the 1,000 nuevos soles that she is asking for, she will stock her business by buying the panetones wholesale and other basic necessity groceries.

loans.use: to buy panetones wholesale and other basic necessity groceries

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en:
Flavia is a 47-year-old married woman and mother of seven children from Ubay, Bohol. 

She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for several years now.

Flavia is requesting a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for the pigs. With this, she will be able to grow healthy pigs.

In the future, Flavia wants to expand her hog-raising business.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feed.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children and all of them are attending school. She is also looking after her parents and her sister. She stays with her husband and the family has access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

She has been keeping poultry for retail at home for the last four years, working seven days a week. She also has rental houses as an additional source of income.

She has requested for a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT-SACCO to enable her buy more bags of chicken feed. 

Her challenges include seasonality, transportation and diseases. Her dream is to increase the number of birds she keeps and start selling chicken feed at both wholesale and retail. 

She joined MCDT because she did not have enough capital to support her business.

loans.use: to buy more bags of chicken feed.

loans.name: Melania De Jesús

texts.es:
Doña Melania,  reside  en  el departamento de Masaya. Con la edad de 65 años maneja su propio negocio, ya que es viuda y manifiesta que ha sacado a sus hijos adelantes. Gracias a su esfuerzo se siente satisfecha ya que sus hijos lograron alcanzar una profesión y también en sus ratos libres le ayudan al manejo de su negocio. Este consiste en la elaboración de deliciosa comida casera, conocida en la localidad como fritangas, ubicado en su casa de habitación, ella ofrece sus comidas en el mismo barrios a los vecinos y transeúntes.
Ella ha buscado la manera de sobresalir  y se siente contenta porque  siempre ha trabajado en lo que ella  aprendió, como es el cocinar. Sus días más productivos son los fines de semana, es cuando tiene más demanda y tiene sus clientes fijos.
Se acerca a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de la materia prima para la elaboración de los alimentos de todo tipo. Ella comprará arroz, aceite, azúcar, salsa de tomate, carne para desmenuzar, molida, posta, lomo, pollo, frijoles, condimentos, entre otros.
Espera confiadamente en que el crédito le servirá de mucho provecho y así continuará supliendo las necesidades de su hogar.
texts.en:
Doña Melania, lives in the department of Masaya. At 65 years of age, she still runs her own business. Although she is widowed, she has managed to work and help her children get ahead. Thanks to her hard work, she is satisfied that her children were able to become professionals. In their free time they also help their mother with her business making delicious home-cooked foods. Doña Melania works out of her home, where neighbors and passerby know she operates a small restaurant. Her busiest days are the weekends, when she has more customers in general, but also many regulars that patronize her business.

Doña Melania, who has always searched for a way to get ahead, is very content because she has successfully used her knowledge of cooking to make a living. She is requesting a loan from Ceprodel that will allow her to buy ingredients for the variety of foods she offers. She will buy rice, oil, sugar, tomato sauce, different cuts of meat, chicken, beans, condiments, and other necessities. She confidently hopes this loan will benefit her business so that she will be able to continue providing for her basic needs at home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as oil, flour, various types of rice, sugar, beans, tomato sauce, salt, beef, pork, plantains, potatoes, tomatoes, sausage, other meats etc. to make a variety of foods.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Bohol, Philippines. 

She has been engaged in seaweed farming, together with her husband, for more than ten years now.

Evangeline needs a loan for the expansion of her business. With a loan, she will be able to buy seaweed seedlings, straw, rope and sticks for seaweed farming.

In the future, Evangeline dreams of improving their business and continuing to support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings, straw, rope and sticks for seaweed farming.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with one child who is not attending school. She also looks after her parents.

She has been operating a retail shop selling basic commodities for ten years, working seven days a week, except when she is sick. She does not have any other source of income. 

She has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to enable her stock more flour, cooking oil, thread, needles, sugar, rice, and stationery to sell. Her challenges include seasonality. Her dream is to own a big stationery shop together with other necessary retail services. She joined MCDT because she wanted to improve her standard of living. She stays in a rented house with her husband; it has access to electricity but not piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, transport, electricity and water.

loans.use: to buy more flour, cooking oil, thread, needles, sugar, rice, and stationery to sell.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She is also looking after her mother. She stays in her house without access to either electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include transport, school fees and water.

She is a tailor, supplying uniforms to schools and carrying out repairs on clothes for 11 years, working six days a week. She does not earn any additional income.

She has requested a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT-SACCO to enable her to purchase rolls of material and thread to make school uniforms for sale. Her challenges include seasonality and defaulters. Her dream is to expand her business. She joined MCDT-SACCO for more capital.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing materials and thread.

loans.name: Gorretti

texts.en:
Gorretti lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a widow with six children, four of whom attend school. She is also looking after her siblings as well. She stays in her house without access to either electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include paying school fees.

She has been selling beans, Irish potatoes, sweet potatoes, cassava and yams in the market at retail for ten years, working six days a week. She also has rental houses as another source of income.

She has requested a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT-SACCO to be able to purchase more yams, sweet potatoes and Irish potatoes for sale. 

Her challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her dream is to grow her business and be able to collect the food herself from the villages, thus yielding higher profits. She joined MCDT because of its interest in serving the poor.

loans.use: To buy more yams, sweet potatoes and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Senor De Mayo-31 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento SENOR DE MAYO-31 está  compuesto por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varón, la presidenta del  banco es la Sra.  Susy tiene 40 años, casada  tiene tres hijos de las edades de 1, 5 y 8 años, dos ellos en edad escolar,   La Sra. Susy  se dedica al servicio de gastronomía, ella elabora comida especial para distintos acontecimientos sociales, ya sea matrimonios, bautizos, etc.   este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Susy va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de utensilios para la elaboración de su comida, ya que estas fechas tiene mucha demanda por la gran cantidad de matrimonios, promociones y bautizos que se llevan a cabo    su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Susy va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así mejorando sus ingresos, La Sra. Susy es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras del grupo ya que en muchos casos son personas que sacan adelante solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The entrepreneurship bank, Señor de Mayo-31, is made up of eight members: seven women and one man. The president of this bank is Susy, who is 40 years old, married, and has three children ages 1, 5, and 8. Two of her children are now in school. Susy makes a living from her cooking business. She cooks for special occasions such as weddings, baptisms, etc. 

This is Susy's second loan from this lending institution. She will use it to buy a variety of kitchen utensils to help her cook during the busy season, full of weddings, promotions, and baptisms coming up. She is requesting this loan in order to continue to improve her business and keep it well-stocked. This will help her increase her profits.

Susy is a very hardworking woman. She is happy that she and the other group members have been offered this opportunity, since most of them are the only source of income to help their families get ahead.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils for her catering business.

loans.name: Rubi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RUBI”  iniciará el decimo sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de tucumanas, venta de camas, pastelería, venta de comida, tejido de chompas, tienda de barrio, venta de golosinas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias con distintos rubros, donde la señora Cecilia es parte integrante, ella indica que es el tercer año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene dos negocios de pastelería, que aprendió en su colegio que le enseñaron oficios técnicos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de harina y leche) que adquirirá de las tiendas distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto, posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito y el compartimiento con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The “RUBI” community association is in its sixteenth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani center.  The group is made up of eight members and directed by a board of directors where Maria serves as the president.  The businesses that the other members have a number of small businesses including: tucumana sales, bed sales, cake sales, food sales, sweater knitting, neighborhood store, and snack sales. 
  

The money from this loan will benefit their small businesses and Cecilia, a member of the group who is her third cycle with Pro Mujer, joined on the invitation of a friend who is also a member.  She has two pastry businesses.  She learned this at a trade school.


She will use the money from this loan to buy flour and milk from distributors in El Alto.  She will later make and sell her products out of her home.  This type of work will allow her to generate income to help support her household.  She is married and has three children.
 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training in health and credit and being with her fellow members.

loans.use: to buy flour and milk.

loans.name: San Martin De Porres Group

texts.es:
La Sra. MAría del Rosario, es socia del grupo de nombre San Martin de Porres, el cual ha sido formado recientemente, entre compañeras de trabajo de la venta de productos de belleza por medio de catalogo y han  incluido a unos vecinos de la zona en la que viven.
La Sra. María del Rosario se dedica desde hace unos años a la venta de productos de belleza, maquillajes, perfumes y joyería, trabajo que realiza por medio de catálogos y acomodando su tiempo libre ya que la facilidad de este negocio es que no tiene un horario fijo de trabajo por lo que ella puede disponer de su tiempo y asi poder dedicarse a sus hijos y no descuida su casa.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de maquillajes y joyería que en éste tiempo por la campaña navideña está a precios de oferta.
texts.en:
Maria del Rosario is a member of the group called San Martin de Porres, which was formed recently by a groups of co-workers who sell beauty products via catalog.  They have included some neighbors from the zone where they live.


Maria del Rosario has been selling beauty products for a few years.  She sells makeup, perfumes, and jewelry and works from catalogs.  She doesn’t have a set schedule and this allows her to adjust her spare time so that she can care for her children and home.


She will use the money from this loan to invest in makeup and jewelry that is available at special prices during the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Lesly Robles

texts.es:
La señora Lesly  Rubenia de 54  años de edad es madre soltera, no tiene hijos que dependen de ella, se dedica desde hace 12  años al negocio de venta de ropa y calzado,  radica en la comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de honduras, su venta la realiza  con las personas que ha diario le visitan en su negocio y amigos que llegan a visitarle.
Doña Lesly está solicitando el préstamo para compra de blusas, sandalias y pantalones, camisas, faldas, calzonetas, tenis y zapatos, con el apoyo de este préstamo ella desea surtir su negocio y prepararse con mercadería para esta navidad, y con las ganancias desea mejorar su casa y también cubrir sus necesidades de salud.
Doña Lesly su sueño es comprarse un carro.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre  del 2012.
texts.en:
Lesly Rubenia is 54 years old and a single mother, although her children are no longer dependent on her for support.  She has been selling shoes and clothing for 12 years and lives in San Lorenzo in southern Honduras.  She sells to friends and other people who visit her business daily.


Lesly is asking for a loan in order to buy blouses, sandals, pants, shirts, skirts, undergarments, sneakers, and shoes.  She wants to use this loan to stock her business and prepare it with Christmas merchandise.  She also wants to use the profits to make improvements to her home and cover her health expenses.


She would like to buy herself a car.

loans.use: to stock her business.

loans.name: Nelly Sohamy

texts.es:
La  Joven Nelly de 21 años de edad vive con su esposo en casa de un familiar, no tiene hijos que dependen de ella, se dedica desde hace 02 años al negocio de venta de ropa nueva, en los barrios y colonias de San Lorenzo, sus clientes le prefieren por su buen trato y por sus buenos precios, vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras.
Nelly está solicitando el préstamo para compra de ropa nueva como ser: blusas, faldas, ropa de niño, pantalones, calzonetas, vestidos, suéteres, calcetines y sandalias. Con el apoyo del préstamo ella va invertir más en su negocio y desea obtener buenas ganancias,  que las utilizara  para seguir invirtiéndolo en su negocio y de esa manera mejorar un poco su calidad de vida.
Nelly su sueño es tener su casa propia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre  del 2012.
texts.en:
Nelly, a 21-year-old young woman, lives with her husband in the house of a relative.  She has no dependent children.  She has made a living for two years in the business selling clothing in the neighborhoods and developments of San Lorenzo.  Her customers prefer her for her good treatment and good prices.  She lives in the community of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras.

Nelly's requesting the loan to buy new clothing: blouses, skirts, children's clothing, pants, underpants, dresses, sweaters, socks, and sandals.  With the support of the loan she'll invest more in her business.  She wants to get good profits, which she'll use to continue investing in her business so she can improve her quality of life somewhat.

Nelly's dream is to have her own house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, November 2012

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, children's clothing, pants, underpants, dresses, sweaters, socks, and sandals
